content: Invitation sent. If you want an invitation, please let me know.

Under is my notes from last meeting, with three main areas for cooperation that can have deliverables in 2020. Please comment.

SHARING DATA OVER FHIR REST APIs -- Proposal of activities to [the standardization group of Nordic Council of Ministers] regarding HL7 FHIR
BASIC DATA ACCESS
- Join an (established) international initiative/project that could be useful for the Nordic countries, focusing on (simple) FHIR REST API data access
- Proposal: International Patient Access (IPA) initiative
- (KISS)
- The Netherlands could be interested in joining
- Activities:
- Join workgroup(s) for proposed initiative(s) with active resources, sponsorship
- Specification work, testing/piloting
Deliverables: [best practice/guide/report]

TERMINOLOGY SERVICES
- Architecture for terminology services
- Lookup, translation, mapping services
Full semantic interoperability regarding coding, even between the Nordice countries, is a long shot. We should focus how we can solve this on relative short term with terminology services/servers for end users (EHRs, apps, etc.)
Deliverables: [best practice/guide/report]

SECURE APIs
- Token exchange, OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect etc.,
- EU initiatives?
This can be seen as a subtask for Basic data access.
Deliverables: [best practice/guide/report]

I agree with all of it ;) I'm a bit concerned about how much of it actually will be possible in 2020 - due to the fact that the authorities (at least in DK) usually focus on the business needs first, and secondly on the standard - which is a fair priority in many perspectives. @Thor Schliemann you might be the best voice here representing danish healthcare authorities: which of the points that @Espen Stranger Seland mentions could gain the focus, funding and interest of the authorities in DK?

Hi. We could focus on the business, it does not have to be technical. We have to scope it down so we can deliver "something". It's a hard task on a tight timeframe. The next meeting in the standardization group under Nordic Council of Ministers is also postponed to late August.

Follow-up:

Do we have some of the 0.5-2 page summaries from each Nordic country regarding governance of FHIR on national level, including profiling?
I'll reach out to @Thor Schliemann to see how far he has come
Updated yesterday, summary from Finland is being worked on, not ready yet.
